3CN/H2O (0.1% TFA)6/4, Rt ═ 11.94 (96.0% dia 2R,3S) and 11.69min (4.0% dia 2S,3S)

The absolute configuration of the carbon bearing the benzyl group is defined by NMR analysis using the rules established in J Med Chem (1986),29,751-753 by Fournie-Zaluski et al.

Thus, the absolute configuration attributed to compound IIa-1 is (2R,3S) and thus the enantiomeric excess obtained during the Michael addition in the presence of a chiral auxiliary is 96%. This chiral synthesis can also be applied to other analogues.

Measurement of restraining force

Inhibitors claimed are in the enzyme family(capable of suppressing them) different Zn2+Assays were performed on peptidases, such as neprilysin type 1 (e.c.3.4.24.11, NEP-1), neutral aminopeptidase (e.c.3.4.11.2, APN) and LTA 4H.

Assays were performed on 99-well plates in the presence of fluorogenic substrates specific for each enzyme.

Generally, the inhibitor is preincubated with the enzyme at 37 ℃ for 10 minutes at increasing concentrations. The substrate is then added and the mixture is incubated at 37 ℃ for 30 to 60 minutes. The reaction was stopped at 4 ℃ and the fluorescence reading was done by reading a Berthold Twinkle LS970B plate. Inhibition curves were then plotted as a function of inhibitor concentration using GraphPad software, and Ki was then determined from the Cheng Prusoff equation: ki ═ IC50/(1+(S/Km))。

Nephrinase (NEP) assay

Nephrinase purified from rabbit kidney (Aubry M et al (1987), BioChemiformecell Biol 65,398-404) was used in 50mM Tris buffer pH 7.4 at a final concentration of 200 ng/mL. Substrate Dansyl-Gly- (NO)2) Phe-. beta. -Ala (Goudreau N et al (1994), Anal Biochem,219,87-95) (Km. about.37. mu.M) was dissolved in ethanol and finally used at 20. mu.M. The concentration was increased (from 10 ℃ C.) at 37 ℃-10To 10-3M) was preincubated with NEP in 50mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4 for 15 min. Substrate was then added and incubation continued for 60 minutes. The reaction was stopped by placing the plate in ice for 10 minutes. The emitted fluorescence was read in a fluorometer with λ ex-355 nm, λ em-535 nm.

Neutral Aminopeptidase (APN) assay

Measurement of aminopeptidase N (APN) inhibition was performed by using the substrate L-Ala ↓ beta-NA (50. mu.M, Sigma Aldrich). Inhibition was achieved by using recombinant human enzyme (rh) (50 ng/mL; R&D System). The concentration was increased (from 10 ℃ C.) at 37 ℃-10To 10-3M) was preincubated with APN-rh in 50mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4 for 30 min. Substrate was then added and incubation continued for 30 minutes at 37 ℃. The reaction was stopped by placing the plate in ice for 10 minutes. The readings of the emitted fluorescence are measured in a fluorimeter with a wavelength λ ex-340 nm and λ em-405 nm.

LTA4 hydrolase assay

To determine the Ki values of the different inhibitors for LTA4H, the concentration was increased (10 of the final concentration) in Tris HCl, 100mM NaCl, pH 7.450 mM, at 37 ℃-10To 10-4M) was preincubated with 0.6. mu.g/mL of recombinase for 30 minutes. The fluorogenic substrate (L) -Ala- β -naphthylamide (1mM) was added in a final volume of 100. mu.L and incubated for 15 min at 37 ℃. The fluorescence values were measured on a Berthold Twinkle LB 970(λ ex 340nm, λ em 405nm, lamp energy 10000). Samples containing 0% hydrolysis were obtained by adding substrate to the buffer and samples with 100% relative activity were prepared without inhibitor. Percent lysis was assessed and compared to 100% relative activity, and IC was determined50The value is obtained. Using the equation Ki ═ IC50/(1+[S]k/Km) the Ki values of the inhibitors (average of at least three duplicate independent determinations) were calculated.

Pharmacological test

Figure 1 shows that intravenous binding OF an inactive dose OF THC and compound Ib-1 induced a considerable synergistic analgesic effect in a hotplate test OF male OF1 mice 10 minutes after injection.
